comments: The 28-digit cycle 1,0,3,4,4,8,2,7,5,8,6,2,0,6,8,9,6,5,5,1,7,2,4,1,3,7,9,3 in this sequence and the others based on twenty-ninths, gives the successive digits of the smallest integer which is multiplied by three when the final digit is moved from the right hand end to the left hand end. [From _Ian Duff_, Jan 09 2009]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
